meanings.definition: A person who is envious or resentful of the good fortune of others.
meanings.sent1: The begrudger at the party couldn't hide their jealousy towards the successful host.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a begrudger and learn to celebrate others' achievements.
meanings.sent3: The begrudger's frown turned into a smile when they received a compliment.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with begrudger's envy as she watched her rival win the competition.
meanings.sent5: The begrudger's green-eyed monster emerged when her friend got a promotion.

meanings.definition: To envy or resent the good fortune of others.
meanings.sent1: She would often begrudge her coworker's success instead of congratulating them.
meanings.sent2: Try not to begrudge others for their accomplishments; focus on your own journey.
meanings.sent3: He begrudged his brother's luck but still wished him well.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds of begrudger's discontent hovered over her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: Begrudging others only brings negativity into your own life.
